course_title: Topics in Black Women's Studies: Mammy and Jezebel
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 22 / Seats Avail: 22Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
Title: Mammy and Jezebel


This course uses literary and historic texts and visual culture to explore (and explode) two controlling images of black women: Mammy a racist caricature of black women as a "beloved" mother figure for white children and Jezebel stereotype created as a racist rationalization for the sexual abuse of black women.
course_description: The course examines how constructions of race and gender control the way black women are represented in literature, film and popular culture from the 19th c. to the present. Students will look carefully at American and Western ideologies of black women.
sections: Class Nbr: 2961, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 11:30a-12:45p, Instructor: K. Wallace-Sanders, Status: Open
